channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Johanna and Mike's Bright Brooklyn Home — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Johanna Lane & Mike Harvkey
Location: Brooklyn Heights,  Brooklyn, New York
Size: 440 square feet
Years lived in: 5 years; Own

Having previously lived in an apartment about the same size as the home that writers Johanna and Mike share, I am acutely aware of how challenging it is to make a space that lacks in square footage feel spacious. That's why I was so impressed by how comfortable and roomy their home feels. 

More
item.author: Liana Walker

item.title: Friday Favorites: Plant Hanger, Teak Chests & Sculpture — The Friday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
It's the end of the week, which means my list of favorites from our Classifieds. Have a wonderful weekend, and happy scavenging!
  • Petworth, WA: Beaded Plant Hanger - $30
  • New York, NY: Danish Teak Chests - $150
  • Brooklyn, NY: Hardwood Chests - $350
  • New York, NY: Mid Century Abstract Sculpture - $100
  • Boston, MA: Blue Traditional Rug - $150

item.description:

What do you love about your bedroom?:
It's simple. I love that. Its like a giant deep breath. I have lots of things out that I like to look at: family pictures, artwork, knickknacks.

item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Brooklyn Lot to be Urban Oasis of Yoga, Gardening, Bike Course — Design News 03.22.13
item.description:
The lot adjacent to the old Domino Sugar factory in Williamsburg is about to be transformed. Plans include space for a reading room, bike courses for beginning and experienced riders, a grassy area for yoga and aerobics, and a community garden. Construction on the 55,000 square foot lot will begin in May. 

In other news, Apple plans to switch data centers to 100% renewable energy, and Architizer announces the winners of their A+ Awards. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Chris & Scott's Spacious & Simple Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Chris / Scott
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
We love that our bedroom is OUR bedroom. It's a space that we have created together. Spacious with two windows providing great views of our neighborhood, the river, and downtown Manhattan. It's simple and clean and everything has it's place.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Renting Done Right: 10 Inspiring Boston Area House Tours
item.description:
More often than not, you'll find something beyond basic white walls in a Boston apartment. Whether it's exposed brick, original wood detailing, charming built-ins, or even just old school radiators and exposed piping, there is usually a unique feature or design challenge to work with. Check out how these 10 renters dressed up their Hub-area homes.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: 5 Mistakes Everybody Makes Decorating Their Home Office
item.description: Certain events are like a rite of passage. Like your Sweet Sixteen, or your first legal drink, or your first apartment... when you bought that really cute but really uncomfortable desk chair. Everybody does it. You just have to learn from your mistakes, move on, and hope that your tastes and talents for decorating your office get better with the next move. More
item.author: Taryn Fiol

item.title: Easter Egg Science Experiments for Children
item.description:
Easter is coming, and it's time to have fun with eggs. To make it fun for parents too, it's come to our attention that science experiments are a nice option for talking about eggs in a different way. 

More
item.author: Séverine Baron

item.title: The Playful Colors and Playlist of an Illustrator — Lifework
item.description:
This week’s well-mixed Playlist hails from Wichita, Kansas. Designer and illustrator, Luke Bott, creates work that reaches a good deal farther. Since graduating in 2002, Luke has been creating design and illustration for clients like Coca-Cola, MailChimp, and Wired UK. His iconic work draws inspiration from mid-century design, children’s books and toys, and vintage ads. Now Luke shares the sonic background of his work with us. Take a listen.

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: Natalie's Spacious Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Natalie
Location:
Toronto Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
So much! It's huge, so it feels like a big airy space where you can breathe. There is tons of wall space, as well, so I have lots of flexibility on how to design and decorate... similarly, the size of the room allows for a *huge* 17-foot long closet where I can organize all of my things. The thing I like MOST, however, are the original architectural details of my room, some of which are over 100 years old... from original doorknob on my door to the stained-glass window of a chickadee that sings over my doorway onto a small breakfast balcony... I mean, could you ask for anything more?


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Black & Bold: Lounge Chair, Missoni & Retro Bar — The Friday MORNING Scavenger
item.description:
There's nothing shy about any of these, so step right up.
  • Brooklyn, NY: Upcycled Lounge Chair - $150
  • Brooklyn, NY: Missoni for Target Bowls - $25

  • Bethany, OK: Basset Dresser - $400

item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Mighty Girl's Dream Bedroom — SF Girl By Bay
item.description:
We all deserve to have our dream bedroom at least once in our life, don't you think? A time when we can decorate our most intimate sanctuary exactly as we'd like, without regard to others. And this? This is Maggie Mason's (aka Mighty Girl's) time...

More
item.author: Bethany Seawright

item.title: Denon DSD500BK Cocoon Dock Stereo — Tech Test Lab Review
item.description:
Product: Denon Cocoon
Price: $599.00
Rating: Weak Recommend*

With speaker docks becoming the boombox of today, it's no surprise that Denon has finally come to the table with its own offering. Features for ease of use are always important, but a full listen often reveals the true tonal balance capabilities of any speaker system. Here we'll dive in and evaluate the true sonic signature of this new Sound Dock from Denon.

More
item.author: Vahan Baladouni

What do you love about your bedroom?:
Although it's low budget and lacking architectural details, my bedroom has a kind of luxurious feeling about it. I love the high ceilings and the calming color palette.

item.title: An Italian Polenta Supper Party
item.description:
This week I've been sharing one of the most fun dinner parties I've ever hosted — we invited six friends over and threw an Italian polenta party anchored by a four-foot-long board in the middle of the table! Here's how it all came together:

• Polenta Supper Party
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: 10 Easy DIY Easter Treat Bags
item.description:
Easter is quickly approaching, but there's still time to make it extra special! These sweet little treat bags are easy to make and would be lovely for holding candy, eggs, or small toys for your little one. 

More
item.author: Lauren Hufnagl

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Thursday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
As we round the corner on the end of the third week of our Bedroom Contest, we have eleven more new entries for your viewing (and voting) pleasure. Check out today's new entries and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Sacha's Black & White Bedroom
  • Angela's Nature Inspired Bedroom
  • Annie's Beach House Bedroom
  • Kellie's Place for Everything Bedroom
  • Debra's Jewel Box Bedroom
  • Laura's Wonderful Belongings Bedroom
  • Carolyn's Decorative Details Bedroom
  • Lisl's Home Office Bedroom
  • Melanie's Little Loft Bedroom
  • Desiree's Soft Industrial Bedroom
  • Meagan's Cozy Cocoon Bedroom

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Meagan's Cozy Cocoon Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Meagan
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is my cocoon. I love the way it feels cozy and warm at night and refreshing and bright in the morning.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Desiree's Soft Industrial Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Desiree
Location:
Amsterdam Netherlands
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the airy feel of it. It is overall white but I have left a piece of the original concrete wall in sight. This gives the room a soft industrial touch that I truly love. I have a locker to store jeans and t shirts and some other things I do not wear very often. On the inside of the doors I added fashion images for inspiration. I love them so much that I often keep one door half open. The colors in my bedroom are mostly black and white with a gray floor ... I add color with different bedspreads and cushions.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: A Creole Country House on the Bayou — Garden & Gun
item.description:
When I was little girl growing up in south Louisiana, my mother would take me on tours of the beautiful old plantation houses in the countryside outside Lafayette. It was the beginning of a lifelong fascination with architecture in general, and Southern vernacular architecture in particular. So when I saw this 200-year-old Creole manor in the pages of Garden & Gun, it brought me right back to my roots. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Amy Pigliacampo's Home Office + Studio — Workspace Tour
item.description:
Name: Amy Pigliacampo
Location: Echo Park, Los Angeles, California
Size: 264 square feet

Last week we got a full tour of Amy Pigliacampo and her husband Corey Szopinski's home in Echo Park. One of the standout features was their organization, which remained stylish, but super functional. Amy's office, which is both her work studio and closet, is an incredible example of this streamlined collectedness. 

More
item.author: Bethany Nauert

item.title: Shop the Set: The Americans
item.description:
The Americans is a new television drama that is bringing an not-currently-in-favor era back into style with mustard yellow and high wasted jeans. The early 1980’s style of the kitchen in The Americans is bringing back wood paneling and Harvest Gold appliances, but there is a modern way to get the early 80’s look without the formica. 

More
item.author: Claire Bock

item.title: Carolyn's Decorative Details Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Carolyn
Location:
Hoboken, NJ
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the high ceiling and stature of our bedroom. I also love the original woodwork and period details in the crown moldings, ceiling medallion, fireplace, pocket doors with etched glass, parlor mirror and window shutters.


More
item.author: Jason Loper
